results.title: Dead reckoning
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Sidney Biddell and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart is at his best as a hard-boiled sleuth in this ‘40s film noir classic. He plays Rip Murdock, an ex-GI trying to discover who framed his pal, Johnny, for murder and then rubbed him out. Tracing his war buddy’s shadowy past leads Rip to Coral Chandler (Lizabeth Scott), who was once Johnny’s sweetheart and is now a chanteuse in a nightclub run by a brutal gangster, Martinelli (Morris Carnovsky). Rip gets a taste of the beautiful blonde’s seductive charms and soon finds himself ensnared in a twisted web of deceit and danger.

results.title: Age of metals: can it last?
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
Episode 7 from the interesting series “Out of the fiery furnace” discusses whether societies accept the environmental penalties of increased metal mining? Are there enough metals left on earth for all who want them? What will we do for energy if the rest of the world is to be carried forward into the Age of Metals? New methods of exploration and detection are shown, including earth-imaging satellites.

results.title: Dear mum
results.creator_credit: Don Marley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Cinesound Movietone
results.brief_description: A highly entertaining and at times funny film about the life of a young soldier in the army. He writes to tell his mum all the great things that happen in the army - like seeing the country; friendship; a lot of spare time and the satisfaction from working as a group.

results.title: Dead Poets Society (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Tony Thomas, Paul Junger Witt, Steven Haft and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: When charismatic English professor John Keating (Robin Williams) arrives at a strict boys academy, his unconventional teaching methods breathe new life into the curriculum steeped in tradition. With his wit and wisdom, Keating inspires his students to pursue individual passions and make their lives extraordinary. (Awards: Academy Award winner for Best Original Screenplay)

results.title: Out of Control
results.brief_description: Developed in co-operation with the Child and Adolescent Psychiatry Unit of the Prince of Wales Hospital, this video shows how to offer support to young children between the ages of 10-14 years, to say “No” to drugs that may be offered to them. It is suitable for use by parents, community organisations, church groups, counsellors and teachers.

results.title: Swords and ploughshares
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
EPISODE 2 OF OUT OF THE FIERY FURNACE - Iron became a universal replacement for bronce; techniques evolved to “steel”, quench and temper it. The Bronze Age collapsed when a new metal “iron” emerged. The Chinese who were the first to cast it, developed huge blast furnaces. The Hittites, of Turkey, were the first to make iron of good quality, and the iron age spread from Damascus throughout Europe. Shows the importance of mining to the ancient civilizations of Grece and Rome. Presented by Michael Charlton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films

results.title: Out on a limb
results.creator_credit: Erik Roberts, Caroline Leaf and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Canadian independent filmmaker and animator Caroline Leaf is most recognised for the animated shorts she created for the National Film Board of Canada. To make her films she prefers alternative methods to the traditional “cell” animation, which she feels is devoid of emotion. “Out on a Limb” is a compilation of her works. In “The Owl Who Married a Goose” (producer, Pierre Moretti) she uses sand to create the the image. With “Entre Deaux Soeurs/Between Two Sisters” (producers, Robert Forget and Yves Leduc)she scratches emulsion from the film stock. In “The Street” (producer, Caroline Leaf), Leaf utilises waterbased tempera colours mixed with oil on milkglass as a medium. Her other films include “The Interview” (producer, David Verall), “I Met a Man” (producer, Caroline Leaf), “The Metamorphosis of Mr Samsa” (producer, Caroline Leaf) and “Hand Crafted Cinema” (producer and director, Erik Roberts), which is a filmed workshop where she talks about her work.
